newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian lending rate flat at 7.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: Croatian lending rate flat at 7.8 pct.

text.p: The Croatian lending rate was flat at 7.8 percent on Tuesday in thin interbank trade, the Zagreb money market reported.
Settlements totalled 23.8 million kuna and dealers put new borrowing at 17.3 million, against supply of 189 million kuna.
Interbank call money was steady at eight percent, with one loan being granted at nine percent and the weighted rate edged down 30 basis points to 8.0 percent.
Insurers' five-10 and 10-15 day loans were flat at seven percent. The 15-30 day loans fell to 11 percent from 12 percent on Monday.
Overnight trade totalled 64 million kuna, leaving a surplus of 395 million kuna after three banks with shortfalls squared their positions.

Croatia's central bank said it stayed out of the foreign exchange market. Its kuna rates for Wednesday were weaker at 5.2919 against the dollar and 3.5590 against the mark. -- Zoran Radosavljevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
